summary:
The fly agaric (Amanita muscaria) is a bright red mushroom with white spots, commonly seen in fairy tales. It's found in forests across the Northern Hemisphere. While it's poisonous, it's not usually deadly. People in some countries cook and eat it to reduce toxicity. This mushroom has a special history; Siberian tribes used it for its mind-altering effects in rituals.

Its iconic look has made it famous in video games and cartoons, but be warned: it's still a poisonous mushroom!
title: Amanita muscaria
